reviewText:
Vicky Saves the Big Dumb World is a very simple game, but also very difficult.
To pass a level you have to die several times.
There are monsters: suicide bombers, ghosts, zombies, and other monsters!
Sometimes the gameplay is inaccurate (especially in the jump) but remains playable.

So Vicky Saves the Big Dumb World is a game made with a low budget, and you notice it, but manages to entertain and offer a few hours of play.
Considering the price, I recommend it!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sK6FbI0Ifr8
(Below is the Italian full review)
Vicky Saves the Big Dumb World è diabolicamente divertente, un'avventura in stile cartone animato, con molta azione e violenza!
Realizzato con amore ed ispirato ai film di serie B (basso budget)
Vicky dispone di una colonna sonora realizzata da MackOne

Feature:
- 18 Livelli
- 4 Livelli bonus
- 4 abilità sbloccabili
- 2 Minigiochi
- Grandi Boss!
- Stupidamente Difficile: i nemici sono maledettamente severi e veloci
- Frutta proibita: Collezionale tutte, per sbloccare minigiochi e nuovi livelli
- 9 Steam achievements

Parere personale:
Vicky Saves the Big Dumb World è un gioco molto semplice, ma anche molto difficile.
Per superare un livello bisogna morire varie volte.
Ci sono mostri: kamikaze, fantasmi, zombie, e mostri di altro genere!
A volte il gameplay risulta impreciso (soprattutto nel salto) ma comunque resta giocabile.

Insomma Vicky Saves the Big Dumb World  è un gioco fatto con un budget basso, e lo si nota, ma riesce a divertire ed offrire un paio d'ore di gioco.
Considerando il prezzo, lo consiglio!

reviewText:
Review + Giveaway x2
Note: keys provided to me by developer

Vicky lives in a big dumb World and she's the only one who can save it. Giant turds are invading the planet and spewing out strange monsters left, right and center. Run, jump and shoot your way past them in this straight forward platformer.

Playing Vicky Saves the Big Dumb World is like playing a no-holds-barred, angry at heart cartoon. Kind of like a more mature version of the excretory product flinging hero of yore Boogerman. Gameplay is simple but fairly tricky at times, providing a good level of challenge that's neither frustratingly hard or overly easy. Long jumps may take a minute or two to adjust to. I felt it necessary to press and hold the jump button ever-so-slightly before the edge of platforms. Objects will remain destroyed after you resume from a checkpoint, which hindered my progress at one point in the 2nd stage such that I had to restart the level. Thankfully, it was a painless one-minute affair to remedy. Each boss encounter is progressively trickier to beat than the last, they get pretty intense!

Presentation/animations are well-done and each stage is significantly different to the other, both in terms of art and enemies. Backgrounds sometimes have multiple overlapping layers that results in a nice visual effect as you pass them by. The music fits the tone of the game and sound effects are suitably bizarre. Getting back to the enemies, I'm not exactly sure what some of them were, but they could be described as creepy and/or funny, depending on your point of view. Butts, the stuff that comes out of butts, sphincters and ..... other indescribable-to-me creatures roam each level. They seem to get weirder with each stage!

Power-ups are rewarded to you after beating each stage and each one adds a new angle to the gameplay which you will be required to make use of. Simple, fun and varied gameplay will keep you occupied throughout. At this price point, I really can't find any reason not to recommend a purchase.

Giveaway here (ending approx. Nov 17th 2015): https://www.bobmanbob.com

Short video playthrough of 1st stage and preview of the 2nd below:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rOa0eMsUQFY
